intro: Didymocarpus elongatus, commonly known as the long-fruited sandollar, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are elongated and contain two seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Didymocarpus elongatus thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often found in lowland forests and along stream banks.
